intro: Euphlebium lacteum, commonly known as the milkweed tree, is a unique plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Euphlebium. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are large, palmately lobed, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are small and clustered, usually in inflorescences, and produce a capsule that contains numerous seeds.
